question_text: A company uses mail.example.com as its email server. You are asked to configure the appropriate DNS records. Which two must be configured to ensure mail delivery works and IP resolution succeeds?
answer_options: A TXT record and a CNAME record
An MX record and an A or AAAA record for mail.example.com
A PTR record and a TTL update
An MX record and a TXT record for SPF
correct_answer: An MX record and an A or AAAA record for mail.example.com
explanation: The MX record tells the world where to send mail. The A/AAAA record provides the IP address for the mail server.
